attributes.action: Hoseasons to refund customers during Coronavirus lockdown
attributes.additional_details:
Hoseasons will not refund customers even though they are cancelling holidays during this Coronavirus pandemic. 

They are offering alternative dates and accommodation which many of their customers don’t want and dates are not available. They have also doubled the prices of  these alternative holidays taking full advantage of the Coronavirus outbreak for their own personal gain.
attributes.background: To enable booked holidays from the 20th March to be refunded back to customers until Coronavirus lockdown is lifted by the prime minister.

rejection.details:
Arrangements for refunding, changing or rebooking travel are a matter for individual airlines and travel agents, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to create a fund to reimburse money lost due to covid-19 travel cancellations, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304912

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
